title: [BUG] run_name doesn't work with start_run

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

labels.name: area/docker
labels.description: Docker use anywhere, such as MLprojects and MLmodels

labels.name: has-closing-pr
labels.description: This issue has a closing PR

body:
### Issues Policy acknowledgement

- [X] I have read and agree to submit bug reports in accordance with the [issues policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md)

### Willingness to contribute

Yes. I can contribute a fix for this bug independently.

### MLflow version

- Client: 1.30.0

### System information

- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: macOS Ventura 13.0
- **Python version**: 3.9.10
- **yarn version, if running the dev UI**: N/A


### Describe the problem

When using MLFlow with the context manager, the specified `run_name` isn't saved to the MLFlow UI.

This issue only happens with version 1.30.0, I tried the following versions as well: 1.27.0, 1.28.0 and 1.29.0. For all of those versions, the `run_name` was saved properly.

### Tracking information

MLflow version: 1.30.0
Tracking URI: https://XXX.com/
Artifact URI: s3://XXX/XXX/artifacts

### Code to reproduce issue

```python
import mlflow

mlflow.set_experiment("mlflow_issue_experiment")
with mlflow.start_run(run_name="test_version_1.30.0"):
    mlflow.log_metric("score", 1)
```

### Stack trace

N/A

### Other info / logs

_No response_
